title: Trump Announces Trade Deal with Japan, Easing Tariff Tensions
snippets: The 15% tax on imported Japanese goods is a meaningful drop from the 25% rate that Trump, in a recent letter to Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, said would be levied starting Aug. 1.
US president says Japanese exports will be subject to a 15 percent tariff under the trade agreement.
The deal will reportedly see the US levy 15% tariff on goods imported from Japan. Donald Trump also said the US would increase exports of rice and vehicles to the East Asian nation.

In his tariff letter sent out to Japan earlier this month, Trump had threatened 25% levies on the country's exports to the U.S., starting Aug. 1.

Tokyo’s failure to secure a US trade deal sooner had caused political uproar and economic uncertainty in Japan, with the prime minister reportedly considering his future

Donald Trump has announced a trade deal with Japan, potentially resolving weeks of fraught negotiations between the two a
Trump initially threatened a 25% tariff rate for Japan that would have gone into effect in August.
titles: Trump announces trade deal with Japan that lowers threatened tariff to 15%

summary: US President Donald Trump has announced a trade deal with Japan, potentially settling weeks of tense negotiations. This follows Trump's earlier threat to impose a 25% tariff on Japanese exports to the U.S. starting August 1. The announcement comes amid political and economic turmoil in Japan, where Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba was reportedly considering his future due to the failure to secure a US trade deal. Details of the agreement remain limited.
constructiveness_reason: The story provides useful information about the recent trade deal between the US and Japan, which could have significant economic implications. However, it lacks depth and details about the deal, and does not clearly explain the potential impacts or solutions to the tariff tensions.

title: Venus Williams, 45, Wins at Washington Open, Becomes Second-Oldest Victor
snippets: Seven-time Grand Slam singles champion Venus Williams, 45, beats Peyton Stearns - 22 years her junior - in the first round of the Washington Open.

Venus Williams became the second-oldest woman to win a tour-level singles match in professional tennis at age 45, beating Peyton Stearns -- 22 years her junior -- by a 6-3, 6-4 score at the DC Open on Tuesday night.
Venus Williams produced a superb display on her singles return on Tuesday to knock out world No 35 Peyton Stearns in straight sets at the Mudabala Citi DC Open.

Venus Williams became the second-oldest woman to win a tour-level singles match in professional tennis, delivering some of her familiar big serves and groundstrokes at age 45 while beating Peyton Stearns — 22 years her junior — by a 6-3, 6-4 score at the DC Open on Tuesday night.
titles: Venus Williams, 45, becomes oldest winner since Navratilova

summary: At 45 years old, Venus Williams defeated 22-year-old Peyton Stearns with a score of 6-3, 6-4 in the first round of the Washington Open, making her the second-oldest woman to win a tour-level singles match in professional tennis. Williams showcased her skill with powerful serves and groundstrokes during the match.

title: Heavy Metal Icon Ozzy Osbourne Dies at 76 After Parkinson's Battle
snippets: The singer helped invent both heavy metal and the image of the wild rock star,  before unlikely reality TV fame.

John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne once admitted that his destructive lifestyle may have killed him years ago. But the "Prince of Darkness" overcame addiction to continue his work and pioneer the heavy metal genre.

Having escaped a life of drudgery in Birmingham, Ozzy became the rare rock frontman you could relate to – and then, against the odds, a national treasure

•

The Prince of Darkness, Ozzy Osbourne, has died at the age of 76, just weeks after taking to the stage for a final performance with the original members of his old band Black Sabbath in Birmingham, England. No cause of death was revealed. Osbourne had been living with Parkinson’s Disease &#821
titles: Wild life of Ozzy Osbourne, rock's 'prince of darkness'
Ozzy Osbourne: The 'Prince of Darkness' who pioneered hard rock
Ozzy Osbourne, the people’s Prince of Darkness, took heavy metal into the light | Alexis Petridis

summary: Heavy metal pioneer Ozzy Osbourne, famously known as the "Prince of Darkness" and a key figure in the creation of the genre and the wild rock star image, has died at the age of 76. Osbourne, who rose from a challenging background in Birmingham to become a beloved figure in music and later in reality TV, passed away after battling advanced Parkinson's disease. His death comes shortly after a final performance with Black Sabbath in Birmingham, marking the end of an era for fans worldwide.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a bit more depth than the previous one, mentioning Ozzy Osbourne's battle with Parkinson's disease and his rise from a challenging background. However, it still lacks actionable insights or a clear focus on solutions or improvements. It does raise awareness about Parkinson's disease, but does not delve into the disease or its impacts.

title: Studies Show COVID-19's Long-Term Effects on Brain Health
snippets: The covid-19 pandemic changed our lives, and the world, in many ways - and now we are starting to understand its wider neurological effects
titles: The pandemic may have aged our brains even before we caught covid-19
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has significantly impacted global health and daily life. This ongoing research aims to understand the full scope of COVID-19's impact on the nervous system.
constructiveness_reason: This story is useful as it provides insights into the long-term effects of COVID-19 on brain health. title: "New DNA Structures May Revolutionize Light, Sound, and Matter Manipulation"
titles: These DNA Structures Could Rewrite the Rules of Light, Sound, and Matter
summary: Researchers have developed DNA structures that may significantly impact the manipulation of light, sound, and matter, potentially altering fundamental principles in these areas. These structures, known as DNA moiré superlattices, exhibit unique properties that could lead to advancements in various scientific fields. The study's outcomes suggest new possibilities for technological innovation and a deeper understanding of the natural world.
